intro: Pluchea bulleyana, commonly known as the slenderleaf blueweed, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, hairy seeds that are dispersed by wind. Pluchea bulleyana is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
